title: SB 1.17.34 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 14-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So, all these different types of worship are in a nutshell explained here by Srila Prabhupada.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the concept of demigod worship within the Vedic tradition, contrasting it with the worship of the Supreme Lord and explaining the different perspectives on God.

segments.key_quote: Yet the rewards of all such sacrifices are awarded to the worshipper by the Supreme Lord only.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on the purpose of worshipping demigods for specific material benefits and mentions the various demigods and forms of the Supreme Lord that are worshipped.

segments.key_quote: Because it is the Supreme Lord who is situated in the heart of everyone, including the Devatas.
segments.summary: This segment explains that the Supreme Lord, as Paramatma, resides in the hearts of all beings, including the demigods, and ultimately awards the results of all sacrifices.

segments.key_quote: That whatever a man may sacrifice to other gods, O son of Kunti is really meant for me alone.
segments.summary: This segment uses verses from the Bhagavad Gita to clarify that all sacrifices are ultimately meant for the Supreme Lord, even when offered to demigods, although often done without true understanding.

segments.key_quote: But Krishna is above this material creation, and he is the lord of everyone.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the Supreme Lord's transcendence over the material creation and His position as the Lord of all, including the demigods, clarifying the correct understanding of demigod worship in relation to Krishna.
